meanings.sent1: The classroom was full of berks who couldn't stop talking during the lesson.
meanings.sent2: The group of berks at the party kept making silly jokes all night.
meanings.sent3: The berks thought it would be funny to wear their clothes backward to school.
meanings.sent4: The berks in the movie were portrayed as clowns, always causing trouble.
meanings.sent5: The image of the berks running around with their pants on their heads was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: A slang term for a person who is annoying or disliked
meanings.sent1: I can't stand that berk who always interrupts others while they speak.
meanings.sent2: The new kid in class turned out to be a real berk, constantly picking on others.
meanings.sent3: The berk kept asking silly questions during the meeting, making everyone roll their eyes.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a berk when she realized she had been talking loudly on her phone in the library.
meanings.sent5: The neighbor's dog barking non-stop was a real berk, disturbing the peace of the neighborhood.
